title: Kelvin
description: The SI unit of thermodynamic temperature. It is defined by taking the fixed numerical value of the Boltzmann constant, k, to be 1.380 649 x 10^-23 when expressed in the unit J K^-1, which is equal to kg m^2 s^-2 K^-1, where the kilogram, metre and second are defined in terms of h, c and Delta_nu_Cs
